an9.6:5.1: “Reverends, you should distinguish two kinds of people:
an9.6:5.2: those you should associate with, and those you shouldn’t associate with.
an9.6:5.3: You should distinguish two kinds of robes:
an9.6:5.4: those you should wear, and those you shouldn’t wear.
an9.6:5.5: You should distinguish two kinds of almsfood:
an9.6:5.6: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.
an9.6:5.7: You should distinguish two kinds of lodgings:
an9.6:5.8: those you should frequent, and those you shouldn’t frequent.
an9.6:5.9: You should distinguish two kinds of market town:
an9.6:5.10: those you should frequent, and those you shouldn’t frequent.
an9.6:5.11: You should distinguish two kinds of country:
an9.6:5.12: those you should frequent, and those you shouldn’t frequent.
an9.6:6.1: ‘You should distinguish two kinds of people:
an9.6:6.2: those you should associate with, and those you shouldn’t associate with.’ That’s what I said,
an9.6:6.3: but why did I say it?
an9.6:6.4: Take a person of whom you know this.
an9.6:6.5: ‘When I associate with this person, unwholesome qualities grow, and wholesome qualities decline.
an9.6:6.6: And the necessities of life that a renunciant requires—robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicinal requisites and supports for the sick—are hard to come by.
an9.6:6.7: And the goal of the ascetic life for which I went forth from the lay life into homelessness is not being developed to perfection.’ In this case you should leave that person at that very time of the day or night, without asking. You shouldn’t follow them.
an9.6:7.1: Take a person of whom you know this.
an9.6:7.2: ‘When I associate with this person, unwholesome qualities grow, and wholesome qualities decline.
an9.6:7.3: But the necessities of life that a renunciant requires—robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicinal requisites and supports for the sick—are easy to come by.
an9.6:7.4: However, the goal of the ascetic life for which I went forth from the lay life into homelessness is not being developed to perfection.’ In this case you should leave that person after reflecting, without asking. You shouldn’t follow them.

an9.6:8.4: But the goal of the ascetic life for which I went forth from the lay life into homelessness is being developed to perfection.’ In this case you should follow that person after reflection. You shouldn’t leave them.

an9.6:9.4: And the goal of the ascetic life for which I went forth from the lay life into homelessness is being developed to perfection.’ In this case you should follow that person. You shouldn’t leave them, even if they tell you to go away.
